description:
Entrepreneur First invests in exceptional individuals to build startups from scratch. We bring together talented outliers to develop their most ambitious ideas and raise money from the world’s best investors.

Since pioneering Talent Investing in 2014, we’ve learned to recognize individuals with extraordinary futures before anyone else, embedding them in a community of ambitious peers and giving them the tools they need to succeed, fast. We back them before they have a company, a team, even before they have an idea, based purely on talent.
The startups cofounded on our programs are now worth over $10B, and include Tractable, Magic Pony Technology, Cleo, La Vie, Aztec, Sonantic, and many more.

EF is backed by some of the world's leading founders and investors, including Patrick and John Collison (Stripe); Reid Hoffman (LinkedIn), Tom Blomfield (GoCardless and Monzo), Sara Clemens (Whatnot and Twitch); Demis Hassabis (Google Deepmind); and Matt Mullenweg (Wordpress). We exist to make great companies happen that otherwise wouldn’t.

For more information about Entrepreneur First, visit www.joinef.com

We're hiring! Join our global team and experience firsthand the workings of a globally unique talent investor working with cutting edge entrepreneurs on world changing technologies: https://careers.joinef.com/
industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
name: Entrepreneur First
tagline: Entrepreneur First invests in exceptional individuals to build startups from scratch.

updates.text:
At EF we believe there are brilliant minds who could build extraordinary companies given the right environment, network, and support.

Building on the success of the Saturday Morning Club in London hosted by Max Mugnaioni, the Paris team are hosting a series of these sessions in partnership with Galion.exe. 

This club is a focused environment outside of work commitments, for exceptional individuals with the ambition to found their own startup one day.

Whether you're waiting to find the right cofounder or need to balance financial obligations, the Saturday Morning Club gives you the support and structure to take the next step toward building your company.

The next session is on November 2nd. 
Apply now 👉  https://lu.ma/smc3

Last Monday the Paris W24 cohort joined the EF team on a trip to the Phagos laboratory in Suresnes, near Paris.

phagos are on an urgent mission to address antibiotic resistance by harnessing the natural predator of bacteria, the bacteriophage. 

Their goal is to turn these bacteriophages into an efficient and sustainable alternative to antibiotics with customizable drugs. Finding the right drug can take anywhere from 2 days (if they already have the bacteriophages) to 2 months.

The founders Alexandros Pantalis (CEO) and Adèle James (CTO) met at EF in April 2021 and described their encounter as (professional) love at first sight. 

They now have a team of 20+ scientists to help them on their mission.

Some exciting updates for EF London's Bio x AI Hackathon (Nov 2nd-3rd) 🚀 

We're teaming up with Amino Collective, an early-stage venture capital firm focused on health and bio, and are delighted to have Founder and Investor,  Nirmesh Patel, join us as a guest judge! 

We’re also thrilled to announce our partnership with Valence Labs, a company working at the cutting edge of AI-for-drug discovery. 

In addition to getting access to high-quality datasets to build with, Valence Labs will be sharing access to their powerful new platform, Polaris, which enables ML engineers to easily share and access drug discovery datasets.

If you're excited by the opportunity to build over a weekend with a room of fantastic technologists and technical mentors, leverage cutting-edge tools, and compete to win a £2k cash prize, apply today — or DM me for more info! :) 

Date: November 2nd-3rd
Apply here:

Check out our September portfolio roundup featuring raises, acquisitions and collaborations for the likes of Qantev, alcemy, Samp, Noah Labs, Encore Musicians, Metis Labs, Qritive, and Transcelestial.

🌽 Excited to share the latest from my Bio-Minds series: "From Waste to Wonder" 

Today, I’m diving into Thalya, one of the most exciting French agritech startups to watch. 

Co-founded by Théo and Hayat at Entrepreneur First, Thalya is tackling fertilizer waste head-on with a pioneering RNAi spray that not only reduces emissions but also supercharges crop yields. 

From their initial ideation in Paris, through field trials in the Midwest, to raising funds in San Francisco, Thalya is poised to redefine the future of sustainable agriculture 🌍

Link here: https://bit.ly/3Bw07yS

36 cofounders
24 weeks
18 pitches - now live on the EF's Demo Day Investor Platform

Watch them here 👉🏻https://bit.ly/470NiIr

Last week we cohosted the Privacy-Preserving AI Hackathon in Paris with Zama & Hugging Face. Over 50 talented developers and innovators from across Europe came together to implement Fully Homomorphic Encryption (FHE) in real-world applications. Their solutions prioritized both innovation and data privacy, with teams receiving guidance from expert mentors from Zama and Hugging Face.

Over the weekend 14 teams worked tirelessly to create solutions that prioritize both innovation and data privacy. These ranged from analysing patient data, to generating watermarks, and detecting deep fakes. A special thank you to Zama and Hugging Face, and all the mentors who contributed their time and expertise to ensure the success of the event. 

Finally we’d like to congratulate everyone that joined us and made contributions to the field of privacy-preserving AI.

Entrepreneur First will be hosting its Summer ‘24 Demo Day in San Francisco tomorrow. The event will be attended by over 250 Partners from top VC firms and will showcase our new cohort of global technologists as they launch their startups in the Valley.
5 days to go until some of Europe’s most exceptional technologists pitch their startups at Demo Day, to a room of Silicon Valley’s top investors.

Applications are now open for our London Spring and Summer programs.

Our talent investors will be meeting people in person at the following universities:

- Edinburgh; 25-26 September, 3-4 October - Kitty Mayo
- Glasgow; 3-4 October - Kitty Mayo
- Cambridge; 8-9 October, 15-16 October - Dominik Diak and Max R.
- Imperial; 14 October, 2 November - Laura Sahyoun
- UCL; 17 October - Laura Sahyoun
- Warwick; 22 October - Jonny Clifford
- Dublin; (Trinity and UCD) 20-22 November - Kitty Mayo

Comment below if they should be meeting you!
